text.p: Banyan Corp said directors approved a one-for-20 reverse stock split of its Class A common stock, effective immediately.
This reverse split will reduce the number of outstanding common shares to 998,301 shares, inclusive of the shares being issued under Banyan's recapitalization plan, it said.
The recapitalization plan encompasses a nonpublic offering of Class A common. Banyan said it expects the offering, for an aggregate of $800,000, will be completed by December 31.
It said the proceeds will be used for repayment of short-term debt and working capital which the company proposes to use for business expansion.

In conjunction with the reverse split and recapitalization plan, Banyan said it will make a rights offering to shareholders of record as of December 9. These shareholders may purchase one right for each share held for $0.01 through January 10. Each right entitles its holder to purchase two shares of common stock at a price of $0.125 a share.
The rights will become exercisable in a series of cumulating portions throughout 1997.
Banyan also said, effective immediately, its common will trade on the OTC Bulletin Board under the new trading symbol "BANY". -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610
